definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to pile up/to heap up/a mass/pile/heap/stack/large amount

sentences.english: Our fur-clad descendents will be crouched over fires.
sentences.chinese: 我們的子孫將穿裘裹皮，蜷縮在火堆旁。

sentences.english: Keep fire a half-step away from standards.
sentences.chinese: 立柱和火堆之間保持半步的距離。

sentences.english: Every man looks at his wood-pile with a kind of affection.
sentences.chinese: 每一個人看見了他的柴火堆都非常歡喜。

sentences.english: The ground cloth or garbage bag is important only in that it makes cleaning up the fire much easier.
sentences.chinese: 使用地席或者渣滓袋只是爲了更利便地清除火堆。

sentences.english: Everything from sides of yak meat to items of laundry was thrown onto the pyres .
sentences.chinese: 不論什麼，從犛牛肉到洗衣用品，都被扔到火堆之中。

sentences.english: He is hiding marijuana in his firewood, " the man says.
sentences.chinese: 他把大麻藏在他們家的柴火堆裏了。

sentences.english: Black smoke came 13 from the fire, and the ground under the fire began to open.
sentences.chinese: 火堆裏冒出黑煙，火底下的地面裂開了。

sentences.english: The dry faggots crackled in the fire.
sentences.chinese: 乾燥的柴禾在火堆裏噼啪作響。

sentences.english: He, too, leaned back, wiggling his unshod toes before the coals.
sentences.chinese: 他也向後倚了過去，在火堆前晃晃赤腳的腳趾。

sentences.english: Zuo Feiyo and Ku Bai gathered some dry branches and made a fire below the tower .
sentences.chinese: 左非右與褲白撿了一些枯枝，在塔下燃起一個火堆。

sentences.english: Draw the chair up to the fire!
sentences.chinese: 把椅子拖到火堆跟前來。

sentences.english: They set up their bunk for the night around the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他們在火堆旁邊支起睡牀準備過夜。

sentences.english: A few at the fire had trained in the Libyan camps.
sentences.chinese: 火堆旁的一些人也在利比亞軍營受過訓。

sentences.english: Hoarsely articulating something in a tongue incomprehensible to the soldiers, they approached the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他們聲音嘶啞，說着士兵們聽不懂的話，走近火堆。

sentences.english: The boys and girls clustered together round the camp fire telling stories and singing songs.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們成羣地圍着營火堆講着故事唱着歌。

sentences.english: The soldiers flung the chairs out of the windows of the senate - house into the square , and began making fires.
sentences.chinese: 士兵們把椅子從樞密院窗戶扔到廣場上，升起了火堆。

definition: to warm oneself at a fire
to make a fire/to light a fire
